answerText: Tunnel magnetoresistance [accept TMR][10] Tunnel magnetoresistance is similar to Giant magnetoresistance, which is often used in these devices that store data on computers. They had a read/write heads and store data magnetically and are abbreviated HDD.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | Finals 1 | 18 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The tunnel form of this phenomenon can be seen in Iron, Magnesium Oxide, Iron sandwiches. For 10 points each: [10] Name this effect whose tunnel form sees electrons pass through a thin insulator that separates two ferromagnets better if the spins of the ferromagnets are oriented parallel as opposed to anti-parallel.
